CatDescriptText: Mr. James (Jimmy) Bates, clerk, Register of Wills office, 16 Tannehill Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A1, with question: "Do you think that too much leniency is shown teenagers who commit crimes?"  Answer reads: "In my opinion there is too much leniency shown. Kids who commit crimes should be handled in accordance with the crime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James "Jimmy" Bates standing in front of wall, with store window on left displaying female mannequin and sign inscribed "there is no time like the present to open and enjoy a charge account," and store window on right displaying jewelry boxes
